derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (as marchpane): from Italian marzapane, possibly from Arabic. The form marchpane (influenced by March and obsolete pain 'bread') was more usual until the late 19th cent., when marzipan (influenced by German, which has the same spelling) displaced it

entry.tran: 杏仁蛋白糖;杏仁蛋白糖霜
entry.def: Marzipan is a paste made of almonds, sugar, and egg which is sometimes put on top of cakes.
